views.markdown:
Enable native PiP in YouTube app.

If you encounter playback speedup issue for your PiP, try to upgrade to YouPiP 1.4.1+ or use iOS 15.0b2+.

If you encounter "No stream Tap to Retry" error for your video, you are recommended to upgrade YouTube to the latest version.

- Migrated YouPiP settings into YouTube's native settings
- Added Non-backgroundable PiP settings option

- Added backward compatibility with YouTube 15.10.4
- Removed potentially unneeded hooks
- Fixed PiP activating on app dismiss even when the mode is "On PiP button tap" issue introduced in 1.4.9

- Refactored logic around PiP activation via button tap
- Reworked settings page
- YouPiP no longer dismisses the app automatically when PiP is activated from the button because the legacy app assertion leads to PiP closing itself

- Fixed crashing on YouTube version 15.49.6 (and maybe lower)
- Fixed crashing on iOS 14.0-14.1 for YouTube version 16.25.2
- Force-enabled YouTube's enablePipForNonBackgroundableContent flag that may fix PiP crashing issue for some people
- Added Sample Buffer Hack in settings (iOS 14)

- Fixed app crashing on some versions of iOS 14
- Added a warning alert if YouTube version is lower than the lowest supported
- Fixed PiP not working on iOS 14.0 - 14.4 for YouTube 16.25.2
- Added few more missing logic from iOS 15.0b2 approach
- Attempted to fix PiP playback speedup bug using iOS 15.0b2 approach
- Enable native PiP toggle inside YouTube settings
- Refactored logic related to bootstraping PiP functionality
- Fixed crash due to adding PiP button to the overlay for some users

- Fixed crash on YouTube version 15.49.6
- Added legacy PiP implementation in settings
- Removed armv7 slice as YouTube targets iOS 11 and above
- Added backward compatibility with YouTube 15.22.4
- "On PiP button tap" should no longer make PiP activated on app dismiss (iOS 14+)
- Added settings page to choose how to activate PiP

- Made PiP activated the first time the app is dismissed (iOS 14+)
- Made PiP activated only when the app is dismissed (iOS 13-)
- Implemented PiP backward-compatible with iOS 13-
